content.description: Learning To Why stand starts on two steps at the base of the slab. Get up on these and use a bomber sidepull out right. Smear hard and go for the lip above without cheating the blocks on the right. Mantle or match hands here and then mantle up and work the last third of the climb to Topout. Pretty committing and fun for the grade. Feel free to input your opinion on grade or course. The necessity to smear well and go for that ledge makes it feel a little stiff but if you go for it V0-1 should be appropriate. Very fun and just the right height.

Cupping A Feel stand starts on the left side of Backrow Baptists boulder which faces north and is just 1’minute east of Ignorance boulder. Get good enough jams to step up and continue chopping or swimming your way upstairs. Good smears and slopers abound when you need them. I wish this thing were 200’ tall! Great warmup or crack trainer for people new to jams.
content.location: Left side of Backrow Baptists boulder  34.7384053, -98.6044199

content.description:
Backrow Baptists is a slopey ledged slab with a wonderful hand crack trainer, Cupping A Feel, on its left side and a slopey line up the middle called, Learning To Why.  

  BB is just east of Ignorance boulder a minute or two so whichever you find first you know to head east or west for more sends / warmups.
